title: A little away from main city
review: The gurudwara is vast having a great Land covered. The Place is serene. This is on the Mathura- Agra highway (NH-2), 10 Kms before the city. A good day visit.

title: Must visit!!
review: A historical place to visit. Free meal anytime and every time for anyone. About 10km from Taj Mahal.

title: Gurudwara of a highly revered Sikh Guru who was Martyred
review: The ninth Sikh Guru Tegh Bahadurji had offered his arrest to Mughal Empror at this pond . Subsequently he was beheaded at place which is a well known Sikh Gurudwara in Delhi popularly known as Gurudwara Sis Ganj . A beautiful Gurudwara came up there and now it is 400 years old . Thousands of Sikh and Hindu devotees visit this place to pay respect to the Great Guru .

title: one of the biggest temple in city
review: without visiting this temple your trip to Agra is incomplete

title: A beautiful Sikh temple
review: Yet another example of how the Sikh's look after their Gurudwara's and greet the many visitors that pass through the doors each day.

title: Divine place for soul soothing visit.
review: Visited this divine place thronged by thousands from all faiths on a holiday on 25th December. Sitting in the main hall was truly soul warming and never felt like leaving. Place is well maintained and offers good facilities for pilgrims from all walks of life and across the country who combined this place with Taj Mahal.

title: Famous gurudwara in Agra
review: This is one of the famous gurudwara in Agra... The architecture of this place is magnificient and place has eternal peace... Must visit for every tourist

title: Divine Place
review: I have visited the Gurudwara Guru ka Tal during the month of January. Gurudwara is very beautiful and clean. One must visit this place during Agra trip.

title: Calm and Serene Place
review: t's a place of worship..

title: Peaceful...
review: It is must watch place if you want some positive vibes, inner peace. It is a divine place. we get tasty food in langar & take some rest.

title: Peaceful place
review: One must visit this Gurudwara when visiting Agra. One gets peace of mind sitting and listening to Gurbani

title: Best Gurudwara
review: This Gurudwara is situated at Agra on a huge land.Its well build and looks very good during Night time with all lights on.

title: Gurudwara guru ka tal
review: Dome shaped building main purpose to worship mainly by shikhs pious place to feel positive and energetic

title: Rich Sikh History
review: This gurudwara was spotted by me while going for Taj Mahal and we visited to pay our respects to Guru Teg Bahadur ji, ninth Sikh Guru, who was imprisoned here for a week or so before bringing him to Delhi.

title: great feeling
review: It is a must go place for every person who visits Agra, and must know the history behind this Gurudwara. Most of the guides dont tell the factual history, so you must ask an official of gurudwara, to know the real history. Visit here with family and friends, pay obeisance, have delicious langer and blessings

title: Beautiful
review: A beautiful Taj Mahal like appearance of a Gurudwara.

title: nice gurudwara
review: Guru ka Tal is a Sikh pilgrimage place dedicated to the memory of ninth guru Tegh Bahadur. It is located in Sikandara area by the side of the Agra Mathura Highway about a km before Tomb of Akbar. This Gurudwara is huge and very attractive. As per history there was a Taal here in past and this was the place where the Sikh Guru Teg Bahadur was arrested and later beheaded by Aurangzeb. This is considered as a sacred place for the Sikhs. A large number of devotees visit this place on everyday and take free langar (food). We also took free langar (lunch) in this Gurudwara.

title: Mesmerizing
review: We visited the place on our way back to Delhi and found it to be a very beautifully built monument and a place of worship for all the Sikh devotees, there are certain areas not allowed for tourists as it is a shrine.

title: quaint
review: the moment you enter the premises, you will be filled with positivity and vibes will calm you down. i make it a point to visit here and also have the langar every time I am in Agra.

title: Pleasant and Pious
review: This is a very famous Gurudwara located almost at the outskirts of Agra towards Delhi. This is quite big and sporadically crowded. The langar as always is great.

title: Guru ka tal
review: Guru ka tal is a one of famous gurudwra of agra..this place is very peacefull and beautifull..must come on your agra trip

title: Great
review: Guru ka Tal is a gurudwara dedicated to the ninth Sikh Guru, Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji. This gurudwara was built at the site where Guru Tegh Bahadur laid down his arms and surrendered to Aurangzeb, the Mughal Emperor. Built in 1610, this gurudwara featured twelve towers in the Tal, out of which only eight towers have survived.

title: nice place but far from agra
review: Very nice and quite peaceful sacred place. Its just far away from agra.

title: Guru Ka tal
review: it is the most famous gurudwara in Agra, it is far from the city center but still attracts a lot of people.. n it has a very good reason to do so .. the place have historic importance too

title: Amazing
review: A single gurudwara in agra ... And attractive thing about this is it's beauty and langar which is 24 hrs open

title: Nice spiritual place
review: Guru ka Tal is basically a Gurudwara near Skindara in Agra situated on Delhi-Agra Highway. Don't forget to take Langar at this place.

title: Teej festival
review: We were going to agra for teej festival and we saw guru ka tal.

title: Homage to Guru Teg Bahadur
review: Originally it was a rain water  reservoir in Sikandara at Agra. It is a historical Sikh pilgrimage place dedicated to the memory of ninth Sikh Guru Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur.  Here the Guru Tegh Bahadur offered voluntary arrest to Mughal emperor Aurangazeb. Several devotees gather every year to pay homage to the great Sikh guru. It is a place of tourist interest in Agra.

title: Nice place!!!
review: Its a very nice place to visit in Sikandra, Agra. The place is very beautiful and we went inside the temple.

title: Divine Place
review: Had you been in Agra, you must visit this Gurudwara. Though it is located at a distance from the centre of city, but still worth a visit. Best part is, you can visit here at time of the day. After visiting various forts and tombs in the day, we came to this Gurudwara at around 7 PM. And it was awesome feeling. This is big, sacred and peaceful. You can listen to kirtan, have guru ka langar and spend some good time. Really a wonderful experience being there.

title: A good historical and religious place.
review: This place is related to Sikh religion but anybody can go here.

title: Guru ka Taal
review: A very beautiful Gurudwara situated on Delhi - Agra highway. So neat and clean and very open spaces around the main hall. People visiting Agra may visit the Gurudwara in all the seasons and pray for peace and happiness in their life.

title: Ultimate Place for Peace of Mind
review: This Gurdwara is a place where you get a peace of mind... cool and quiet that you immediately go into a meditative state on your own and be one with god.  Cool during summers also from inside.  An architectural marvel and still the kar seva is going on.

title: Historical Gurudwara dedicated to the memory of ninth Guru Sri Guru Tegh Bahudar Ji.
review: This mesmerizing historical gurudwara was built back in 17th century in the memory of Guru Shri Teg Bahadur Ji. Built with white marble, this is a huge sikh pilgrimage with wonderful architecture. It is on NH2 and is easily locatable. The place has a huge parking space too. The gurudwara is super lit and decorated on special occasions.

title: Historical and a very well maintained Gurudwara Sahib !
review: Guru ka Tal is a Historical Gurudwara where Guru Teg Bahadur Ji courtes arrest, before being taken to Delhi. The building has well conserved architectural elements of yester years and that is why comes across as original. Otherwise too, you can see that the management works hard from it's manicured gardens, the chair lift they have installed for differently abled.

title: sacred place
review: Nice and peaceful place, you will feel inner piece while being there, apart from that anyone can get food and tea from there as all time langar is there, if you are there don't forget to visit museum in side the gurudwara as it it apart from main building.

title: Peaceful Place
review: Its very nearby to Akbar's tomb in Sikandara. This gurudwara is part of rich Indian history. Must visit.

title: Peaceful
review: Very well managed and peaceful though upgradation was going on. Good food in free kitchen along with delicious kheer.

title: Divine Place
review: The gurudwara is located at the place Shri Guru Teg Bahadur ji was kept as prisoner. It is a wonderful place with great ambience. Once you visit this place then you would get divine feeling.  There is no issue of the parking as it has a very big parking place.  It is located about 5 kms from Raja ki Mandi Railway station. Some shops are outside the Sikh temple to fulfil your basic needs.

title: Gurudwara Worth Visiting
review: Guru ka Tal Gurudwara is about an hours drive from Agra. The gurudwara is very well maintained with nice lawns on either side of the main entrance. The langar (free food for the visitors) is very well organised and visitors made to feel welcome. Overall a very nice and peaceful place to go to.

title: Must Visit
review: Guru ka taal must visit for its historical importance..beautiful and clean well maintained..24 hrs Langar,peaceful,divine experience

title: Nice cozy place to spend a great evening
review: Wonderful experience. The ambience is good, calm and peaceful. Being on the highway, it is connected very well. Ample parking space inside so you don't have to worry about that thing.

title: Awesome place where u get full peace of mind
review: A place for worship and having full peace of mind in agra situated on agra to delhi national highway no-2 that GURUDWARA GURU KA TAAL.

title: Sat shree Akal
review: This Gurudwara is more than 400 years old {it was told to me}

title: Peaceful and enchanting
review: Its very near to my home. I have visited this place many times. with friends as well with family. Loved it. I have tried langar couple of times. It right on NH2, so easy to find. Mut visit.

title: peaceful & beautiful place!
review: Basically it is a gurudwara. It is Agra's second big gurudwara. It is very nicely built and it is having three main buildings all are very beautiful you can really feel so peace & alive. Love the place. Must visit it hardly take 1 hr to visit this place. Very good place.

title: Had Langar at Guru ki Tal
review: Serene Place away from the fast paced life. Go there as its different and you will find yourself in this peaceful atmosphere.

title: Must Visit for all
review: This Gurudwara is also known as Dhuk Niwaran Gurudwara, it's a great place to visit. This holy place of worship has a beautiful architecture. The visitors feel tranquility and a great positive vibe. People from all religion can visit. Best time is early morning.

title: A Historical and Peaceful Gurudwara
review: This Gurudwara is the most visited one in the city of Agra but the fact which makes it most famous is that it was where Aurangzeb arrested the 9th guru of the Sikhs - Guru Tegh Bahadur Singhji and thus it has historical significance for Sikhs. There are two main buildings in the complex and the taal is also there. The tranquility and peace of the place is mesmerizing and one cannot help but feel spiritual once at this place. For a more authentic and local experience try the langar food which is free and very tasty. The entrance is also free.

title: Beautiful and Divine Place
review: Guru Ka Tal is a beautiful Religious Place.Its so clean and so Divine that you can find your Inner Soul here.There is a very good Arrangement of Staying here.One can take an AC room or Non AC room at very very nominal charges for Maintenance.The Food is Free at the "Langar" (Free Kitchen run by Religion). There is a Big Parking Lot with a few shops providing all basic things to the visitors.The gardens are beautiful and overall premises is very clean.You will feel yourself close to God.

title: Must visit if once wants a spiritual experience
review: The Gurudwara Guru Ka Taal is located on the Delhi - Agra Highway about 5 kms from the Raja ki Mandi railway station. This is the place where the 9th Sikh Guru and Hind Ki Chadar  - Guru Tegh Bahadur Sahib was kept under arrest for 9 days by the Mughals. The Gurudwara Sahib building is quite large and there are 3 main areas. First one is the main darbar hall on the the top where the prakash of Guru Granth Sahib is done. Second is the place where Guru Sahib was kept which is near the main entrance. Third is the place where guru sahib sat.

title: Divine feelings scattered all-around
review: This place has divinity in every inch of it. Located on the noises of highway this place is a real relief. Lunger gives me immense pleasure whether I eat it or serve it.

title: Very Calm place in the middle of traffic
review: This place is clean, calm & divine. You will feel awesomely peaceful throughout the place. Don't forget to eat the Lunger & perform seva.

title: Truly devine place
review: This is the place where guru tegbahadurji of sikhs was arrested by aurangzeb n later beheded in delhi

title: Huge and beautiful gurudwara
review: I have been twice to this gurudwara and it is really nice, huge and beautiful. It is visible from the highway and is really enchanting.

title: sikh religious place
review: Guru ka Tal  is Sikh pilgrimage Gurudwara, related to 9th guru SRI GURU TEGH BAHADUR SAHIB JEE good beautiful building and big Tal/water tank and a display of arms .Visiting this place makes us feel blessed. when you feel tired in the crowdy city then must come here for some time sit and relax in the darbar hall of gurdwara sahib you feel peace and calm

title: A must visit place in agra
review: I visited this place and it's very peaceful and beautiful. Never forgot to visit this place if you go Agra. It's outside of the city but on road easily reachable.

title: EXECLLENT!
review: It is a beautiful gurudwara built outside of the city and hence very peaceful. it was a great visit!

title: Big gurudwara on the high way
review: It was a very pleasant and informative visit.

title: Waahe Guru.
review: A very calm n composed religious place which gives immense peace and blessings.

title: Peace Peace Peace
review: Really when I do work daily, life looks so hectic, then you need some peace of mind, that what I got here. Gives positive energy.

title: Best Kept Sikh Religions Seat
review: A very clean and well maintained Sikh Religious Seat at Agra is Gurdwara Gur Ka Tal. as you enter the sweet sounds of religious prayers fill your ears. You are given Par-shad in form of Halwa and can have free meals here 24 hrs 365 days. Must Visit.

title: Famous Gurudwara(SikhTemple) in memory of Guru Teg Bahadur jee
review: Famous Gurudwara(SikhTemple) in memory of Guru Teg Bahadur jee.This is the place where Shri Guru Teg Bahaghur jee stayed during there Agra visit. Such a clean and quiet divine place with 24 Hours langer

title: Very peaceful place
review: Sikh temple devoted to the memory of great Sikh  Guru Tej bahadurji. Very calm and quite place will feel full of positive energy. Very nice halwa Prasad. Free meals serving to pilgrims round the clock.

title: Positivity and Peace
review: After the drive through the most chaotic traffic of Agra when you reach Guru Ka Taal, you will find Peace.. Peace.. and Peace. Such a majestic temple with full of positivity.

title: Divine
review: In a city of incessant hustle-bustle, one would definitely love the calmness and peace of this place. You can visit during noon and savour Guru ka Langar

title: Nice Well kept ancient Gurudwara .
review: We visited this Gurudwara on Sunday, it was little busy . Guru kat Talbot is Sikh pilgrimage Gurudwara,  good beautiful building and big Tal/water tank and  a display of arms . They run a free kitchen / Langar, where you can have free vegetarian meals. It takes around one hour to visit this place.

title: Very peaceful place
review: Seems you are so closed to almighty

title: A divine experience.
review: If you are coming to Agra, you must visit to this sacred place.  It's a very huge gurudwara and a historical place too. Architecture is very beautiful and very peaceful. Guru Ka Langar served here day and night. If you want to stay you can be provided nice and clean rooms without any charge but you have to keep in your mind that this is a religious place and you can't use any tobacco or liquor product. It's on the Agra Delhi Highway many truck drivers stay here and rest here.

title: Peaceful & Serene...
review: The ninth Sikh guru was passing by the town on his way to Anandpur Sahib when he was arrested by Aurangzeb’s men and detained at this location for nine days. He was later transferred to Delhi and executed there. Only eight towers of the original twelve have managed to survive time and the elements of nature. It is not a very popular tourist spot but an important one for history buffs.Very calm and quite place will feel full of positive energy.

title: Nice place For Peace
review: Peace harmony & Faith all around atmosphere give a deep

title: Nice Historical Place Good Natural Views
review: This is a historical place of Sikh Religion related to Guru Teg Bhadhur

title: The biggest Gurudwara I have seen!
review: This is for the 3rd or 4th time I am visiting this place. The aura of the place itself gives you a feeling of peace. The Gurudwara is very grand and spread across widely. It is located near the highway. For everyone visiting the Taj Mahal, they can accommodate this as well in their trip.

title: HISTORICAL GURUDWRA
review: We visited this holy Gurudwara situated on Agra-Mathura Highway in Sikandara Area of Agra at noon and guruvani was going at that time. A nice huge structer and master piece of archetecture made from white marble. A must visit place of Agra. According to legends, Guru ka Tal is a historical Sikh pilgrimage place dedicated to the memory of ninth Guru Sri Guru Tegh Bahudar Ji. Guru ka Taal is near Sikandra in Agra. TheGurudwara was built over the place where the Guru Tegh Bahadur laid down his arms to offer arrest to Aurangazeb, the Mughal Emperor. Several devotees gather every year to pay homage to the great Sikh guru in this Gurudwara

title: Enormous
review: Peaceful..... Quite..... Clean..... Immense. I went gurukatal 2 times. My first visit was with my friends and second with my cousins. Devotees and other working staff there are very courteous and I always feel restful and pleasant when I am here. The best place to meditate and slacken your stress.

title: Guru ka Taal
review: One of the most holistic place for Sikhs in Agra . You will be amazed by the neatness of this place . Every one is so humble and comparative . Lungar is served for hundreds of guests daily and you will be amazed to see how it does .

title: Divine place
review: This is the place where Guru gobind singh ji had stayed for some time....it is now a gurudwara and an institution teaching Sikhism to young children...the gurudwara houses the original arrows and weapons of Guru gobind singh ji....there is round the clock food served at the community kitchen (langar)...its simple but delish food....dont forget to donate whatever you wish at the exit of the langar hall....

title: Historic Gurudwara Sahib
review: This is the place where Shri Guru Teg Bahaghur G stay during there agra visit. Such a clean and quiet divine place.Gurudwara sahib is situated on NH 2. Accommodation is also available.

title: Beautiful!
review: I visited the gurudwara just before i left agra. It is a very peaceful place and one should definitely visit. It is dedicated to the memory of the ninth Guru, Guru Teg Bahadur who was kept here under custody. Stayed there for about an hr. There is a lot of parking space. 24 hr langar service is provided.

title: Great experience
review: Amazing experience at the Gurudwara, The best part is the special strip on the marble to control heat

title: True positivity
review: Visiting this place makes us feel blessed.  The vibrations are positive. It feels good. There is guru ka Langar which is 24 hours. This Langar is a must visit as it gives you felling of fulfillment. Sitting on floor and eating tasty Langar with full devotion is a great feeling. Visiting this gurudwara is truly awesome experience.

title: Guru Ka Tal
review: Gurudwara, Guru Ka Tal is a historical Sikh pilgrimage place dedicated to the memory of ninth Guru Sri Guru Tegh Bahudar Ji.

title: Beautiful!!!
review: very peaceful place..when you reach here you will feel relaxed...i must say evreytime I go here is an amazing and different expirience!!

title: Off the beaten path
review: The architecture and setting of this gurudwara is peaceful.  The gardens are well maintained and a good spot for some good photos.  This history behind this location is significant as well.  An hour to visit this location, eat something and get some photos is sufficient.  Not crowded at all, we went in the morning. Plenty of parking is available.

title: Must Visit
review: Guru Teg Bahadur Surrendered to Aurangzeb here and he was kept in prison here only thereafter. This place is a must visit pilgrimage just before Sikandra Tomb. Gurudwara is excellent and very clean and huge.

title: Biggest Gurudwara of Agra
review: Its the biggest gurudwara in Agra, if you are coming from Delhi via Mathura road, you will see it on your side while entering the city. Its a beautiful place and serves amazing Langars.

title: Just like any other Gurudwara
review: I was recommended this place by my friend but it was just like any other Gurudwara. Its on AH-1 or Mathura Agra highway. Hence it can visited if you are planning to visit Agra from Mathura by road. I found this place can be missed if you have visited any other gurudwaras before.

title: Religious Place
review: very peaceful and calm place to relax & be with GOD and Nature. Went with my wife and enjoyed the environment in guru ka tal.

title: Soothing your soul
review: Its a place where everyone wants to be at times of trouble & mental exhaustion. its peaceful & soothing air will heel you soon.

title: A good place
review: Guru ka tal is a good place to visit, but I felt government needs to pay more attention to its maintenance...

title: Must visit!!
review: A historical place to visit. Free meal anytime and every time for anyone. About 10km from Taj Mahal.

title: A beautiful Sikh temple
review: Yet another example of how the Sikh's look after their Gurudwara's and greet the many visitors that pass through the doors each day.

title: Gurudwara of a highly revered Sikh Guru who was Martyred
review: The ninth Sikh Guru Tegh Bahadurji had offered his arrest to Mughal Empror at this pond . Subsequently he was beheaded at place which is a well known Sikh Gurudwara in Delhi popularly known as Gurudwara Sis Ganj . A beautiful Gurudwara came up there and now it is 400 years old . Thousands of Sikh and Hindu devotees visit this place to pay respect to the Great Guru .

title: Historical religious place
review: It is very important historical place. Guru Teg Bahadur was kept here under custody. Presently this area is very well developed and maintained.  24 hour Langar service provide free food that is prasada.  Everything is very much systematic.

title: one of the biggest temple in city
review: without visiting this temple your trip to Agra is incomplete

title: A little away from main city
review: The gurudwara is vast having a great Land covered. The Place is serene. This is on the Mathura- Agra highway (NH-2), 10 Kms before the city. A good day visit.

title: Divine place for soul soothing visit.
review: Visited this divine place thronged by thousands from all faiths on a holiday on 25th December. Sitting in the main hall was truly soul warming and never felt like leaving. Place is well maintained and offers good facilities for pilgrims from all walks of life and across the country who combined this place with Taj Mahal.

title: Famous gurudwara in Agra
review: This is one of the famous gurudwara in Agra... The architecture of this place is magnificient and place has eternal peace... Must visit for every tourist

title: Divine Place
review: I have visited the Gurudwara Guru ka Tal during the month of January. Gurudwara is very beautiful and clean. One must visit this place during Agra trip.

title: Peaceful...
review: It is must watch place if you want some positive vibes, inner peace. It is a divine place. we get tasty food in langar & take some rest.

title: Calm and Serene Place
review: t's a place of worship..
